title: Bug 49195: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried.
OB: When using Tomcat as a Windows service and specifying port 1 as the shutdown port in the server.xml file, the service is able to stop successfully. However, during the shutdown process, an error message is printed.
EB: If the shutdown port is set to 1, the service should stop without any error messages being printed.
SR: 1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. 2. Start the service. 3. Stop the service. 4. Shut down the server using an OS signal or by calling Catalina.stop() function.
